div.p: I'm Bob Bailey, a Learning Specialist with Brightcove.
In this video, you'll learn how to add captions to your
videos using Video Cloud Studio.
Closed captions can be added to your videos to provide
additional or interpretive information to individuals who
wish to access it.
Captions are necessary so the deaf and hard of hearing can
access the audio portion of video presentations.
Brightcove supports adding captions to your videos,
either by using the Media module and Video Cloud Studio,
or by using the Smart Player API.
To add captions to a video, you first need to create a
captions file.
Brightcove supports both DFXP and SMPTE-TT format.
To create my captions file, I uploaded one of my videos to
one of our partners, 3Play Media.
They are just one of our partners that provide
transcription and captioning services.
For a complete list of Brightcove partners, visit
brightcove.com, and click on the partners link.
Once a transcription is complete, I could download the
captions file in DFXP format from the 3Play Media website.
Next, I need to associate the captions file with my video.
To do this, I'll go into the Media module, locate the
video, and click Edit.
Go to the Advanced tab.
In the Closed Captioning section, you have two options
on how the captions file is handled.
You could upload captions file to Brightcove and let
Brightcove host the captions file for you, or you can
select Remote and provide the URL to where your captions
file is located.
I'm going to select the Upload option, and then click on the
Upload button to browse, and select my caption file.
After the file is done
processing, click Save Changes.
To see the captions, I'm going to do a
quick Publish My Video.
I will select my video.
I'll go to Quick Video Publish, select a player, and
then copy the URL.
Next, I'll paste the URL into my browser.
Any player that has a video with an associated captions
file will display a CC icon on the player chrome.
I can click the CC button to toggle the
captions on and off.
That's how easy it is to add captions to your videos.
